meanings.definition: A large, heavy blow or stroke.
meanings.sent1: He felt a clow on his head after the ball hit him.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler delivered a powerful clow to his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The clown accidentally gave himself a clow on the nose with the rubber hammer.
meanings.sent4: The thunder sounded like a giant clow hitting the ground.
meanings.sent5: The tree fell with a loud clow, shaking the entire forest.

meanings.sent1: She had to clow the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would clow the hot metal to shape it.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to clow the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The waves clow against the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The boxer trained hard to clow his opponent with a knockout punch.

meanings.definition: A lump or mass of something, especially of earth or clay.
meanings.sent1: He found a clow of mud stuck to his shoe after walking in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The potter shaped the clay into a beautiful clow for the vase.
meanings.sent3: The child made a clow of sand and pretended it was a mountain.
meanings.sent4: The farmer dug up a clow of potatoes from the field.
meanings.sent5: The artist sculpted a clow of marble into a stunning statue.
